item.title: Setting up this site
item.description:
source/or

  • Use a Hugo theme and customize it
  • Script below to add the images from .md to the static dir

Windows (updated)

import os
import re
import shutil

# Paths
posts_dir = r"E:\Documents\scratch\themes\nostyleplease\content"
attachments_dir = r"E:\Documents\Obsidian\Merged\Attachments"
static_images_dir = r"E:\Documents\scratch\static\images"  

# Regex pattern to find image references in the format ![[some/path/image.png]]
image_pattern = re.compile(r'!\[\[([^]]*\.png)\]\]')

# Step 1: Process each markdown file in the posts directory and subdirectories
for root, _, files in os.walk(posts_dir):
    for filename in files:
        if filename.endswith(".md"):
            filepath = os.path.join(root, filename)
            with open(filepath, "r", encoding="utf-8") as file:
                content = file.read()
            # Step 2: Find all image links
            images = image_pattern.findall(content)
            # Step 3: Process each found image
            for image_rel_path in images:
                image_source = os.path.join(attachments_dir, image_rel_path)  # Full path in attachments
                image_name = os.path.basename(image_source)  # Extract only filename
                image_dest = os.path.join(static_images_dir, image_name)
  
                # Step 4: Copy the image if it exists
                if os.path.exists(image_source):
                    shutil.copy(image_source, image_dest)
                    print(f"Copied: {image_source} -> {image_dest}") 

                    # Step 5: Replace the old link in Markdown with the new format
                    markdown_image = f"![Image Description](/images/{image_name.replace(' ', '%20')})"
                    content = content.replace(f"[[{image_rel_path}]]", markdown_image)
                else:
                    print(f"Warning: {image_source} not found")

            # Step 6: Write the updated content back to the markdown file
            with open(filepath, "w", encoding="utf-8") as file:
                file.write(content) 

print("Markdown files processed and images copied successfully.")

Linux

item.title: Immunotechnology
item.description:
Useful material

https://www.cellsignal.com/pathways/immune-cell-markers-human [[Immune-Cell-Markers-Human 1.pdf]] [[janeways-immunobiology-9th-edition_compress.pdf]]

Immune system - Lecture A

[[Lecture A]]

  • Cytokines = affect the behavior of immune cells, they are called interleukins when produced by lymphocytes
  • Chemokines = simulate the migration and activation of cells

Immune Cells

! All Immune cells arise from one pluripotent hematopoietic bone marrow stem cell. Ex

  • Monocytes - circulate in the blood stream and differentiate into macrophages in tissue
  • Mast cells - related to allergy response

Innate vs Adaptive immune system

Somewhat arbitrary distinction.

item.title: Medicinal Chemistry
item.description:
This note was imported from Google Docs and not properly reformatted!

Lecture 1

Chapter 1 

1.1
‘good’ vs ‘bad’ drugs is nonsensical.
(Barbiturates where used as general anesthetics to Perl Harbor casualties, which led to more deaths than the wounds themselves.
Heroin was named so for its ‘heroic’ effectiveness and is still used as  diamorphine for treating cancer patients. Curare is used as a muscle relaxant.)
Instead the wider definition for drugs as components, that interact with biological system causing a biological response is used.

item.title: Bread
item.description:
Whole grain - DK

Day 1 (soaking)

  • 225 g cracked ray grains
  • 225 g seeds
  • 300 g warm water
  • 75 g acidic sourdough 

Leave soaking covered for 6 h or over night

Day 2

  • 300 g whole grain rye flour
  • 300 g warm water
  • 180 g acidic sour dough 
  • 15 g salt
  • Optional malt/brown sirup (~30g)

Add everything together with the soaked seeds and add more rye flower/water until the consistency of minced meat is reached.

item.title: Deserts
item.description:
Milchreis (rice Porridge)

  • 200 g short grain rice
  • 200 ml water
  • 500 ml milk
  • vanilla sugar to taste
  • cinnamon to taste

After washing the rice, add water and bring to a boil. Then lower to medium heat and add the milk and let simmer for 30 min or until the rice is tender. Add seasoning to taste.

Coconut variant

  • 200 g rice
  • 300 ml water

Cook the rice, while preparing the sauce

item.title: Main courses
item.description:
Pizza and Pasta

Penne Arrabiata

  • 300 g penne
  • 500 ml sieved tomato’s
  • 4 cloves of garlic
  • 4-5 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp chili flakes
  • 2 tsp salt
  • opt fresh Basil
  • opt 2 tbsp tomato purée

While cooking the penne in salted water finely chop/crush the garlic and fry together with the chili flakes under medium heat until the garlic just starts to turn brown. To the garlic add ca. 50 ml of penne water and 500 ml of sieved tomatoes. Combine sieved pasta with sauce. Optionally add fresh Basil
